fields.headline: Spring coats
fields.bodyText: £70 Cotton tulip shape. By Oasis, 01865 881986 The ostrich approach to coat-buying at this time of year just won't cut it. Facing up to the fact that your dark wool winter coat has passed its best-before date, and the "cardi only" solution is making you both scruffy and chilly is the mark of a pragmatic shopper. But practical need not mean boring. The key is to seek out a spring coat that is lightweight while offering sufficient coverage. A longer-line tailored coat with bracelet sleeves, like those by Cos and Marks & Spencer, is the perfect solution. Bright colours, as demonstrated by America Ferrera, are another spring coat failsafe, because they suggest sunshine even when the weather doesn't deliver. For those who are not yet ready to hang up the trench coat, a printed version from Monsoon continues the mac theme without the bad weather associations. Length-wise, if you wear wide-leg trousers look for coats that end above the knee, and if you wear skirts keep it tidy with a coat to the knee - unless you favour minis. £65 Printed linen.
